Rework of Thing #155236 (by UnClaimedCarg0) - Tadis toy with opening doors, "Police Box" signs, and spot for top LED.  About 2.5" tall (63.24 mm tall).  Rescaling is not a good idea due to precise 5mm LED hole.

Printing is very straight forward.   
The Police Box sign boards need you to have your bed leveling and offset set VERY precisely for the test to show properly.  
Things get a bit "messy" when printing the top of the box, but if you let it keep printing, it seems to work out in the end and the top will come out OK on the outside with some cleanup on the inside where you don't see it anyway.  
I've been having a bit of issues with the door fitting so you might need to do some small drilling to get the doors to mount.  Because of gap span printing inaccuracy around the door opening, I have gone back and printed slightly taller doors to fit better if the original doors do not make it..

comments.text: I tried to make this, using a MakerBot Replicator 5th generation.  I used a raft, but no supports.  Without the supports, the top of the doorway failed -- not a surprise.  But I wanted to see what the limits were for bridging a gap.  The doors and police box signs were really thin.  I couldn't get the doors off the raft without breaking the spindles.  And I couldn't get the police box signs off the raft at all.  So, if you try making this, consider using supports and not using a raft.  Other than that, the box itself looked pretty good up to the top of the windows.

title: Modular Mini Tripod
license: Creative Commons - Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike

description.text:
Sturdy tripod with modular mounting plate.
I included smartphone holder (PhoneHolder_(1-3).stl) and mount for 1/4 inch camera bolt (Plate_QuarterInch_Bolt.stl).

For those who would like to create their own mount for their device i included Fusion 360 file about Blank plate (PlateBlank.f3d). I can collect links for accessories here.

Assembly:

  1. Insert Tripod_Lock into Tripod_Ball with teeth facing inwards.
  2. Screw Tripod_Ring into Tripod_Lock. (Threads are left handed)
  3. Insert Tripod_Top into its hole and secure it with screw (lock assembly).
  4. You can figure out rest yourself :)

If you face any problems i'm happy to help.

Happy printing!

Printer Brand:

Prusa

Printer:

Prusa Mk2

Rafts:

No

Supports:

No

Resolution:

0.2

Infill:

20%

Notes:

Additional Hardware:
3pc m4 x 20-25mm screws for legs.
1pc m4 x 20-30mm screw for lock assembly.
3pc m4 x 12-20mm srews for mounting plate.
Screws can't be with traditional hex head, since they have to be used with screwdriver.
Maximum head with: 8.5mm
Longer your screws are stronger your tripod is.

title: x-end for prusa i3 with printed and integrated linear bush

description.text: Es un rediseño de las piezas laterales del eje X de las prusa i3 que su principal característica es que tiene incorporado el buje impreso en vez de usar rodamientos lineales. Los originales son de la versión "vanilla" de la prusa i3, el buje lineal es el https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:1430232 al que se modificó para integrarlo al código de los x-end. Otros cambios menores es la adición en el x-end-motor de la pestaña para un tornillo de fin de carrera Z y el cambio en el x-end-idler para que pueda usar 608zz y el eje correspondiente de 8mm. Está impreso en PLA, el buje luego de impreso se "fresa" usando una broca de 8mm para alisar las paredes interiores y se lubrica usando wd40 de silicona (para plasticos). Anda muy bien, y tiene menos juego y ruido que usar rodamientos chinos baratos. Está impreso con pico de 0.8 con altura de capa de 0.3

title: 3Dtouch / BLtouch bracket for Geeetech Prusa I3
license: Creative Commons - Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike

description.text:
This simple mount alignes the sensor tip to the pivot line of the extruder, thus making the sensor less sensitive to bends or misalignment of the extruder carriage, as with the mount suggested by Geeetech that places the 3Dtouch in front of the extruder carriage.
I sometimes had to readjust the offset setting in eeprom, now I get consistent measurements every time.

Please note that you need to extend the arm that actuates the X home sensor, otherwise the carriage will jam on homing.

author: veeectorm2

description.text:
Replacement feet for the N1 PC case. It will raise the case approximately 15 mm from the original feet. Allows for much better airflow and it may also allow for mounting slim fans on the bottom of the case for those space limited using a bottom mounted radiator.

Rotate the picture around to see how it was hollowed out. Default Thingiverse image is in the upside-down position.

Sanding and painting as appropriate.
Add some sort of pad/rubber/foam to the bottom after mounting the feet to prevent scratching the surface.

Loosely based on a design someone else did on [H] but larger and hollowed out so it could be printed on a DLP printer or an FDM printer.

Hole is recessed in the bottom so that an M3 screw head will not protrude.
Just create a simple box with a lid. All walls can be configured to have round holes, square holes, hexagon holes, cross holes etc.

Need M5 nut and screw (or you can use screw that came with camera accessories)
